meanings.definition: Spread to other parts of the body, typically referring to cancer cells.
meanings.sent1: The cancer was metastasizing, moving from the lungs to the liver.
meanings.sent2: The tumor was metastasizing, causing concern for the patient's health.
meanings.sent3: The cancer cells were having a party, metastasizing all over the body.
meanings.sent4: Fear was metastasizing in her mind like a wildfire, consuming all rational thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The idea of failure was metastasizing in his thoughts, paralyzing his actions.

meanings.sent1: The cancer cells were metastasizing, spreading to distant organs.
meanings.sent2: The patient's condition worsened as the cancer was metastasizing rapidly.
meanings.sent3: The cells were playing a game of tag, metastasizing from one organ to another.
meanings.sent4: Hope was metastasizing within her, spreading its light to every corner of her being.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of joy was metastasizing in her heart, filling her with warmth and happiness.

meanings.sent1: The wildfire was metastasizing, spreading across the dry forest.
meanings.sent2: The rumor was metastasizing, reaching every corner of the school.
meanings.sent3: The laughter was metastasizing in the room, infecting everyone with joy.
meanings.sent4: The idea was metastasizing in his mind, evolving into a brilliant plan.
meanings.sent5: The excitement was metastasizing in the crowd, creating a buzz of anticipation.
